node.html: I'm a budding software engineer based in North Central Jersey, open to any Software Engineering or Software Development intern positions for the summer of 2019.

I'm an aspiring software engineer who is excited by opportunities to solve intriguing problems, regardless of the technology stack. Through my past professional experiences, I've been tasked with devising technological solutions that meet needs whilst working with previously unexperienced programming languages, like Ansible Tower and Jenkins Pipeline.

I'm currently a Junior, studying Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, NJ, as a student in the Rutgers Engineering Honors Academy. I myself am a newcomer to computer science, but in a little over 3 semesters of coursework, I believe I've developed into an avid programmer that can quickly learn new skills and apply them with ease. This can be attributed to my desire to never be idle and to constantly be challenged through school or exploratory side projects. My engineering knowledge and coding skills have helped me appreciate computers and the beautiful potential within.

Here are a few things I'm experienced with:

• Converted Puppet manifests to Ansible playbooks, which are fed into a Jenkins Pipeline and orchestrated by Packer to create a Windows AMI
  • Wrote Python scripts that utilized the AWS Boto3 SDK to configure certain infrastructure settings, such as CloudTrails, EC2 Instances, volume encryption, as well as validate changes and deployments to Prudential-managed accounts
  • Automated the creation of AWS accounts with Python scripts that implemented specific AWS infrastructures via tags-value pairs, user permissions, and other EC2 configurations
  • Worked in an Agile Framework in the Cloud Operations and Platform Engineering Divisions

• Worked at the OIT Computing Help Desk, which is dedicated to providing prompt, courteous and effective service to the Rutgers New Brunswick/Piscataway campus and the Rutgers community
  • Troubleshot all aspects of supported desktop computing during the semester and during regular University business hours between semesters

• Customer Service: Attended customers' problems, both in person and through calls.
  • Footwear Specialist: Advised customers on the best shoes to buy based on budget and occasion.
  • Store Duties: Monitored and organized the store for the best presentation possible.
